page.title: 04The White Tower
page.content:
{ Ramsey Windmill
The Mill at Ramsey,is one of the most dominant features,and is an interesting piece of{local history. As you would expect it is situated at the top of the hill,and can be seen from all angles.Originally Ramsey had no mill,but did have a{bakery}of it's own. In 1842,Mr.J.Brook purchased a mill from Woodbridge in Suffolk(which had two),and had it brought to the village.It was used for almost 100 years after this,and only fell into dis-use at the start of the War in 1939. In 1973 the present owner bought it,and saved it from collapse.It has been repaired with set sails;any visitors are asked to call at Mill house,before proceeding.
